Action.author: angelo.decaro
Action.body: ~mastersingh24 , let's consider a policy that can be satisfied by any two members of Org1. Then a malicious member of Org1 can manipulate his certificate by changing its ECDSA signature. Notice that the new certificate is still valid. The new certificate and the old one have different representation and therefore will be considered as coming from different entities. This should be avoided in a way or in another. Wdyt?
